headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Flights Halted Across The U.S.; Deadly Storm Slams California With Heavy Rain, Massive Flooding. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: LYNDA HOPKINS, SUPERVISOR, SONOMA COUNTY
utterances.sentences: We`ve got trees down. We`ve got mudslides. We`ve got actually folks trapped in areas where we have majorroad failures.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: At least 17 people have died as a result of the storms, after more than 18 inches of rain fell in parts of southern California. And high windadvisories were issued on the central coast. In San Francisco, a rare hailstorm in Haight-Ashbury. And throughout northern California --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The rain hammered here pretty bad.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: -- the rushing river has flooded, following torrential downpours. Some residents have been without power for a week. In Santa Barbara County,mass evacuations, after that storm saturated the ground.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It was pouring, the wind was whipping.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Following years of extreme drought and fires.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: On the mountainside here, the debris started coming down, filling up to four feet or so. Pretty much buried the truck, and nowit`s starting to flow.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: More than 30 million people are under flood alerts, and across southern California, flash flooding trapped drivers. Firefighters hererescued a motorist stranded in rushing waters. And mud and rockslides creating havoc for residents.

utterances.speaker: TYRONNE MCGRATH, RESIDENT, CASITAS SPRING
utterances.sentences: A 800-pound rock just smashed the house, it just hit the wall and blew everything out.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: In northern California, the rain flooded roads, and vineyards, it almost doubled the snow pack in local mountains, offering hope that thesestorms may somehow ease California`s historic drought.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We`re riding through it. Yeah, it could be a lot worse.(END VIDEOTAPE) LAH (on camera):  It`s hard to think about drought when this is what southern California is dealing with. I`m standing on a roadway that goes back behind, me you cannot see it because of all the debris on this road. This came from this mountain, this hillside five years ago burned in a wildfire. And with all the rain and lack of vegetation, it all came down onto the street and into these yards. The concern now is what happens in the upcoming days, with rain in the forecast.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Up next, we`ll hear from Vanessa Yurkevich, a CNN business and politics reporter, who recently took a look at social media, specificallyTikTok`s impact on teen brains. Her reporting focuses on social media usage and the rate of depression especially among Gen Z users. Her research comes as more than a dozen state governments have actually banned TikTok on government-issued devices and at least 22 states have taken some sort of action on TikTok since 2020. So let`s hear more about her research in the teens she speaks with on the ground. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) VANESSA YURKEVICH, CNN BUSINESS AND POLITICS REPORTER (voice-over):  In just five years, TikTok has amassed more than one billion global users. Eyeballs around the world glued to the endless content and viral videos. How long do you think you spend on TikTok every day?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Two to three hours.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Three to four hours.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: But last month, the U.S. government, along with more than a dozen states, banned TikTok on most federal devices, citing nationalsecurity concerns over its Chinese parent company and the possibility it could pressure TikTok to hand over personal data. There is no public evidence the Chinese government has done that but there is evidence of another risk, social media`s impact on mental health particularly among Gen Z. DR. JEAN TWENGE, PSYCHOLOGIST:  Teen depression started to rise after 2012. So did self-harm.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: Dr. Gene Twenge says as smartphones and social media grew, so did the rate of depression among teens, nearly doubling between 2004 and2019. By that year, one in four U.S. teen girls had experienced clinical depression according to Twenge.

utterances.speaker: TWENGE
utterances.sentences: What the algorithms trying to do is get people able to use the app for longer because that`s how the company makes more money.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: TikTok in a statement said, quote, one of our most important commitments is supporting the safety and well-being of teens and werecognize this work is never finished. We continue to focus on robust safety protections for our community while also empowering parents with additional controls for their teen`s account through TikTok family pairing. Users of TikTok spent an average of an hour and a half a day on the app last year, more than any other social platform. What is it that keeps you scrolling even if you know maybe you`ve spent one two hours on it?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Once you watch the one video, you`re like, well, time to watch another. So you just keep doing it`s like a cycle you don`trealize that the time is passing.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: That`s exactly what happened to Jerome Yankee (ph).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I`ve definitely done all-nighters on TikTok before I had just been scrolling until the sun came up.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: He says he lost sleep. His grades suffered. He lost touch with his friends. He lost his sense of self. In 2021, he deleted the app.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Getting disappointed by my own life is never something I want to be doing, especially when I have the power to change it but Ijust wasn`t because I was spending hours on this app.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We have like a lot of cool resources that we give to our audience for free.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: But Hannah Williams (ph) proves the positive side of TikTok, allowing her to create a business, Salary Transparent Street, providingpaid transparency to her new nearly million followers.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think TikTok definitely helped just because they have such audience reach potential.

utterances.speaker: YURKEVICH
utterances.sentences: She hopes TikTok`s algorithm works in her favor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Helping people in marginalized communities is the only reason I am doing this. It`s my entire mission.(END VIDEOTAPE)
